item.title: How to check the binding glibc version of a binary
item.description: There are several ways to check the glibc version that a binary file depends on:: ldd command ldd binary_file objdump, disassembly objdump -T binary_file | grep -i glibc readelf readelf -d binary_file | grep libc check dynamic section to get libc versionã€‚ check the source code repo If you can access the source code, check the building scripts for the glibc versionã€‚ rpm/deb package manage tools How to check RPM Dependencies gdb debugging gdb binary_file print (const char*) ELF->gnu_required->name show the glibc SONAME version when linkingã€‚ strings extracting strings binary_file | grep GLIBC extracting glibc symbols version prefixesã€‚.

item.title: Storage Related
item.description: GitHub - louwrentius/fio-plot: Create charts from FIO storage benchmark tool output You need to run benchmark first, then use the tool to generate Charts, I think it is Boring.

item.title: CICD System
item.description: Jenkins Implemented by Java ï¼Œpipeline defined by Jenkinsfile, can achieve CI as Code. Master-Slave architecture. There are abundant plug-ins, but many of them are in a state of no maintenance, are usable but have a lot of Warnings.
